title: 113_hr4652
content: The Act may be cited as the "Increasing Small Business Lending Act" and includes fee reductions. The "Increasing Small Business Lending Act" includes fee reductions for Small Business Administration loans until September 30, 2015. The Administrator is required to eliminate or reduce fees for approved loans under section 7(a) of the Small Business Act and section 3 of the Act. Additionally, temporary fee elimination is implemented for the 504 Loan Program. The "Increasing Small Business Lending Act" includes temporary fee elimination for the 504 Loan Program until September 30, 2015. The Administrator will collect no fee for approved loans under section 503(d)(2) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. The "Increasing Small Business Lending Act" temporarily eliminates fees for the 504 Loan Program until September 30, 2015. Development companies that do not collect processing fees will be reimbursed by the Administrator. The reimbursement amount is 1.5 percent of the net debenture proceeds. The Administrator will use available amounts to eliminate or reduce fees for small business borrowers and lenders based on specific criteria outlined in the Act. The Economic Stimulus Lending Program for small businesses is outlined in Section 3 of the Act. The Administrator may guarantee up to 90 percent of small business loans made by eligible lenders. Definitions include terms like "Administrator," "qualifying small business loan," and "small business concern." Certain loans are excluded from this section. Loan guarantees under this section are prohibited for concerns with unlawfully present aliens holding ownership interests. Additionally, entities violating immigration laws by hiring or recruiting undocumented aliens are ineligible for loan guarantees. Before approving a loan guarantee, the Administrator may conduct criminal background checks on applicants using the National Crime Information Center system. This section does not exempt the Administrator's activities from the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990. The Small Business Act provisions applicable to loan guarantees under section 7 of that Act remain in effect. Loan guarantees under this section are subject to existing laws and regulations, with a sunset provision limiting issuance to one year after the enactment of the Act. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out this Act.
